did.unittitle: Richard Harding Davis to [Alexander] Black February 2, 1891

scopecontent.p: Davis apologizes for not sending a photograph quickly and asks for a copy of a camera-lecture.

did.unittitle: Richard Harding Davis to [Alexander] Black February 9, 1891

scopecontent.p: Davis gives his assurances that his editorial work will not interfere with his writing.

did.unittitle: Richard Harding Davis to [Alexander] Black October 16 [1891]

scopecontent.p: Davis thanks Black for his kind words.
Davis informs Black that Harper'scannot use his article or photographs which Davis had solicited.
Davis thanks Black for his interest and information and mentions a future visit to Brooklyn.
Davis criticizes a story that Black has submitted to Harper'sand suggests that it be altered.
Davis writes concerning a man claiming to be president of the Browning Society of Brooklyn who is submitting previously published poems as his own work.
